intro: Delosperma abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian ice plant, is a succulent plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Delosperma abyssinicum is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
